QuoteSaveEvent.name: QuoteSaveEvent
QuoteSaveEvent.description: Notifies subscribers that the process started by the Place Quote or Place Sales Transaction API request is complete. If the process is successful, use this event to learn about the updated quote. If the request isn't successful, use this event to learn about the errors and how to fix them.

EventUuid.description: A universally unique identifier (UUID) that identifies a platform event message.

QuoteId.description: The ID of the quote associated with this event. This field is a relationship field.

ReplayId.description: Represents an ID value that is populated by the system and refers to the position of the event in the event stream. Replay ID values arenâ€™t guaranteed to be contiguous for consecutive events. A subscriber can store a replay ID value and use it on resubscription to retrieve missed events that are within the retention window.

RequestIdentifier.description: ID of the request that triggered the event.

QuoteSaveEvent.accessRules: This object is available in orgs with Subscription Management or Revenue Cloud.
